chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis F Ortiz Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Luis F Ortiz Martinez. Defendant Luis F Ortiz Martinez not in court, in custody.   Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer, enters a speedy trial demand and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 45 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Luis F Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Pittman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court in person for Luis F Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Clerical error occurred and no subpoena was issued. Case is adjourned. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 088090,
Payable Number: 1032107,
Receipt Number: 22RP036887,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Luis F Ortiz. Defendant Luis F Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Hearing as to counsel. Defendant has been appointed counsel. Case needs a preliminary hearing. Case adjourned, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee Hearing.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; filed.
Case assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Appointment Status Letter, received and filed

Defendant Luis F Ortiz not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. 
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests a State V. Lee Hearing. Court denies State's request and adjourned matter for  CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with SRE, TRJ, TAJ 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis F Ortiz
Current: 4951 S 110th St, Greenfield, WI 53228   (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 3719 North 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Luis F Ortiz in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis F Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25. All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
